noun.description: A piece of jewelry that hangs from a chain worn around the neck.
A light designed to hang from the ceiling.
The part of a pocket watch by which it is suspended.
An artistic, literary, or musical composition intended to match or complement another.
examples: the triptych's pendant will occupy the corresponding wall in the south transept

origin: Middle English (denoting an architectural decoration projecting downwards): from Old French, literally hanging, present participle of the verb pendre, from Latin pendere.
